text: The 1973 European Super Cup was played between 1972–73 European Cup winners Ajax and 1972–73 European Cup Winners' Cup winners Milan. With Ajax winning 6–1, it was the worst defeat for an Italian team in an UEFA competition final. ==Schedule== Unlike future Super Cup matches, the 1973 edition took place at the start of the following calendar year rather than the start of the following season. ==First leg== {| style="font-size: 90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" GK 1 Villiam Vecchi CB 2 Giuseppe Sabadini CB 3 Aldo Maldera CB 4 Angelo Anquilletti RWB 5 Karl-Heinz Schnellinger LWB 6 Maurizio Turone RM 7 Alessandro Turini CM 8 Romeo Benetti CM 9 Gianni Rivera (c) LM 10 Giorgio Biasiolo CF 11 Luciano Chiarugi Substitutes: Substitutes: Substitutes: GK 12 Pierluigi Pizzaballa MF 13 Dario Dolci MF 14 Franco Bergamaschi DF 15 Giulio Zignoli DF 16 Enrico Lanzi Manager: Manager: Manager: Cesare Maldini Cesare Maldini Cesare Maldini Cesare Maldini ==Second leg== {| style="font-size: 90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" GK 1 Heinz Stuy RB 2 Wim Suurbier CB 3 Barry Hulshoff CB 4 Horst Blankenburg LB 5 Ruud Krol DM 6 Arie Haan CM 7 Johan Neeskens CM 8 Jan Mulder RF 9 Johnny Rep CF 10 Gerrie Mühren LF 11 Piet Keizer (c) Substitutes: Substitutes: Substitutes: FW 12 Arno Steffenhagen MF 13 Zoltán Varga DF 14 Pim van Dord MF 15 Arnold Mühren GK 16 Sies Wever Manager: Manager: Manager: George Knobel George Knobel George Knobel George Knobel ==Related pages== *1973 European Cup Final *1973 European Cup Winners' Cup Final *A.C. title: 1973 European Super Cup
